qas.question: Who granted the privilege of Piotrkow?
Privilege of Piotrkow was granted when?
WHat happened to the nobilities feudal power?
Who was allowed to leave the village?
What were the townsfolk prohibited from doing?

context: <a1_0>On April 26, 1496<a1_0/> <a0_0>King John I Albert<a0_0/> granted the Privilege of Piotrków (Polish: "Przywilej piotrkowski", "konstytucja piotrkowska" or "statuty piotrkowskie"), <a2_0>increasing<a2_0/> the nobility's feudal power over serfs. It bound the peasant to the land, as only <a3_0>one son (not the eldest)<a3_0/> was permitted to leave the village; townsfolk (Polish: "mieszczaństwo") were prohibited from <a4_0>owning land<a4_0/>; and positions in the Church hierarchy could be given only to nobles.
